column1: #Text=For a history professor who purportedly is an expert in this area, he missed some Canadian history.

#Text=One of the key reasons private property is not a Charter Right is because provinces in the 1980s were worried about foreign, at that time, American and Germans buying up shorelines and farmland, locking out local populations.
#Text=They wanted to have the right to impose a tax to curb foreign buyers.
#Text=Ontario, PEI and a few others implemented a tax to curb outside buyers from purchasing property in their respective provinces.
#Text=The BC tax is nothing new and, if history is any guide, will only last a for a few years until the market cools and prices start dropping dramatically.
